items.sentence: I still have a lot of questions I want to ask you.
I stood on a chair so I could reach the top shelf.
I stopped sending Christmas cards a few years ago.
I stopped sending Christmas cards three years ago.
I suggest you wait until Tom tells you what to do.
Mary is the only girl Tom is really interested in.
Mary wore her bikini under her shorts and T-shirt.
Tom and Mary entered the library at the same time.
Tom and Mary have a very complicated relationship.
Tom and Mary have lived in Boston for three years.
Tom and Mary often talk to each other using Skype.
Tom is the only adult Mary knows who can\'t drive.
Tom isn\'t sure what he wants to do with his life.
I\'d like you to look after my dog while I\'m out.
The police suspect that Tom poisoned Mary\'s food.
The policeman cuffed Tom\'s hands behind his back.
The post office is a few minutes\' walk from here.
The problem is I don\'t know where my umbrella is.
The problem is we\'re not sure Tom can do the job.
The problem is what Tom does when we aren\'t here.
Tom wanted to go, but he had lots of things to do.
Tom wanted to prove to his friends he could do it.
Tom wants to live in the country after he retires.
Tom wants to spend the rest of his life with Mary.
Tom began to work for our company three years ago.
Tom believed he could actually predict the future.
Tom believed that nothing bad could happen to him.
Tom bought a cup of coffee from a vending machine.
Tom bought his daughter a new dress for the party.
I understand that you\'re a good friend of Tom\'s.
Tom has a couple of friends who speak French well.
I think I was about thirteen when I first met Tom.
I think Tom and Mary are too young to get married.
I think Tom has never done that by himself before.
I think Tom was trying to warn us about something.
Did you really think I wouldn\'t help you do that?
Tom didn\'t let Mary play with the other children.
Tom is the only one who doesn\'t have an umbrella.
I assume that Tom doesn\'t have that many friends.
When eating, don\'t speak with food in your mouth.
Tom is always getting people to do things for him.
Tom is better off than he was this time last year.
Tom is by no means unintelligent. He is just lazy.
Tom is in the kitchen, cutting up some vegetables.
I want my children to have the best of everything.
I want to find somewhere I can sit down and relax.
I want to get Tom something nice for his birthday.
Both drinking and smoking are bad for your health.
By the time we got there, it was already too late.
Tom told Mary that he\'d help her, but he didn\'t.
